maml:description.maml:para: Get the properties of a Storage Account
This cmdlet allows you to get the properties of a specified Storage Account or all Storage Accounts within a Resource Group or the subscription.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get a specified storage account --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> #Get one storage account Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "rg1" -AccountName "mystorageaccount"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get all Storage Accounts in a Resource Group --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Get all Storage Accounts in a Resource Group Get-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "rg1"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get all Storage Accounts in the subscription --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Get all Storage Accounts in the subscription Get-AzureRmStorageAccount

maml:description.maml:para: Get the access keys for an Azure storage account
This cmdlet allows you to get the access keys for an Azure storage account.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

maml:description.maml:para: Check the availability of a storage account name.
This cmdlet allows you to check whether the specified storage account name is valid or available to use.
Storage account name to be checked.
Storage account name to be checked.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Check availability of a storage account name --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Get the storage resource usage of current subscription.
This cmdlet allows you to get the storage resource usage of current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Get the storage resources usage of current subscription --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Allows you to create a new Storage Account
This cmdlet allows you to create a new Storage Account.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

Type of Storage Account. Valid values are • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS (Zone-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage)
Location of the Storage Account
Tags to set on the storage account.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

Type of Storage Account. Valid values are • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS (Zone-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage)
Location of the Storage Account
Tags to set on the storage account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

maml:description.maml:para: Regenerates a storage key for an Azure storage account.
Regenerates a storage key for an Azure storage account.
Name of the Resource Group the storage account is in
Name of the Storage Account
Specifies which key to regenerate. Supported value set: - “key1” - “key2”
Name of the Resource Group the storage account is in
Name of the Storage Account
Specifies which key to regenerate. Supported value set: - “key1” - “key2”

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

Remove Storage Account from Azure
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the VM
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the VM

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

maml:description.maml:para: Update the Storage Account properties
This cmdlet allows you to update the Storage Account properties.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

Specifies the account type of the storage account. One of four options: • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS
Note that Standard_ZRS accounts cannot be changed to other account types, and other account types cannot be changed to Standard_ZRS.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
The name of the custom domain.
Indicates whether indirect CName validation is enabled.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account
Tags to set on the storage account.
Name of the Resource Group
Name of the Storage Account

Specifies the account type of the storage account. One of four options: • Standard_LRS (Locally-redundant storage) • Standard_GRS (Geo-redundant storage) • Standard_RAGRS (Read access geo-redundant storage) • Standard_ZRS
Note that Standard_ZRS accounts cannot be changed to other account types, and other account types cannot be changed to Standard_ZRS.
The name of the custom domain.
Indicates whether indirect CName validation is enabled.
Tags to set on the storage account.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: azure, azurerm, arm, resource, management, manager, storage, container, account

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Set Storage Account type --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> # Set account type Set-AzureRmStorageAccount -ResourceGroupName "myresourcegroup" -AccountName "mystorageaccount" -Type "Standard_RAGRS"
